impact-statement: Kindlin-2 co-operates with talin to activate fibronectin-binding integrins on fibroblasts and subsequently induces cell spreading by recruiting paxillin to small, peripheral nascent adhesions.

contribution.con1: MT, Carried out most experiments and data analysis, evaluated and interpreted the data.
contribution.con2: MW, Carried out most experiments and data analysis, evaluated and interpreted the data.
contribution.con3: RTB, Tested integrin activation, paxillin recruitment and the kindlin-2 interaction with paxillin in vivo, evaluated and interpreted the data.
contribution.con4: ER, Performed immunoblottings and PCR experiments
contribution.con5: MV, Produced recombinant kindlin-2 and paxillin.
contribution.con9: DJM, Evaluated and interpreted the data
contribution.con10: RZ, Crossed talin mice, established cell lines, evaluated and interpreted the data.
contribution.con11: RF, Initiated, conceived and directed the project, evaluated and interpreted the data and wrote the manuscript.
